Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that is healthy with plenty of water and light, including green leaves and vibrant growth.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy without enough water, such as showing wilted leaves or drooping stems.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy without enough light, perhaps with faded or pale leaves.
The student can show and label what happens to plants when they do not get water, such as indicating wilting or dehydration.
The student can show and label what happens to plants when they do not get light, such as stunted growth or yellowing leaves.
The student can compare healthy and unhealthy plants to identify patterns, such as labeling the benefits of water and light versus their absence.
The student can illustrate and label where plants can and cannot grow, based on light and water availability, effectively demonstrating suitable and unsuitable conditions for plant growth.
CANNOT: Minor gaps may occur, such as missing a label or misplacing an illustration element, but the student shows a robust understanding overall.
